results.title: ASP.NET Core Blazor state management overview
results.description: ASP.NET Core Blazor state management overview This article and the other articles in this node describe common approaches for maintaining a user's data (state) while they use an app and across browser sessions, including during server prerendering. Third-party state container products and services that work seamlessly with Blazor, such as Flux,.

descriptions.content: ASP.NET Core Blazor state management overview This article and the other articles in this node describe common approaches for maintaining a user's data (state) while they use an app and across browser sessions, including during server prerendering. Third-party state container products and services that work seamlessly with Blazor, such as Flux,.

results.title: React on Windows
results.description: React is an open-source JavaScript libr... React is really only concerned with state management and rendering that state to the DOM, so creating React applications usually requires the use of a routing library like React Router. Redux: A predictable state container that helps with data-flow architecture. It is likely not something you need until.

results.title: Web Chat customization in the Bot Framework SDK - Bot Service
results.description: Activities and attachments render are sent thru a customizable pipeline that modeled after Redux middleware. The pipeline is flexible enough that you can do the following tasks easily: Decorate existing activities/attachments Add new activities/attachments Replace existing activities/attachments (or remove them) Daisy chain middleware together.

descriptions.content: Activities and attachments render are sent thru a customizable pipeline that modeled after Redux middleware.
